com.hazelcast.map.impl.querycache.accumulator

Interface Accumulator<E extends Sequenced>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the allowed type for this accumulator to accumulate.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicAccumulator, SubscriberAccumulator

    public interface Accumulator<E extends Sequenced>
extends Iterable<E>
    Accumulator for events which have a sequence number. Only allows read access to elements in it, except reset() method.
    See Also:
    Sequenced

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accumulate(E event)
      Adds event to this accumulator.
      AccumulatorInfo getInfo()
      Returns AccumulatorInfo of this accumulator.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this accumulator contains no elements.
      Iterator<E> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the items in this accumulator in proper sequence.
      int poll(AccumulatorHandler<E> handler, int maxItems)
      Reads this accumulator if it contains at least maxItems, otherwise do not read anything.
      int poll(AccumulatorHandler<E> handler, long delay, TimeUnit unit)
      Reads all expired items to the supplied handler.
      void reset()
      Resets this accumulator.
      boolean setHead(long sequence)
      Tries to set head of this accumulator to the supplied sequence and returns true, if that sequence is still exist in this accumulator.
      int size()
      Current size of accumulator.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • accumulate

        void accumulate(E event)
        Adds event to this accumulator.
        Parameters:
        event - event to add.

      • poll

        int poll(AccumulatorHandler<E> handler,
         int maxItems)
        Reads this accumulator if it contains at least maxItems, otherwise do not read anything. If this method adds items to the supplied handler, head of this accumulator advances. Used for batching purposes.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler to process this accumulator.
        maxItems - read this accumulator if it contains at least maxItems
        Returns:
        the number of elements read.

      • poll

        int poll(AccumulatorHandler<E> handler,
         long delay,
         TimeUnit unit)
        Reads all expired items to the supplied handler. If this method adds items to the supplied handler, head of this accumulator advances.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler to process this accumulator.
        delay - after this duration element will be poll-able.
        unit - time-unit
        Returns:
        the number of elements polled.

      • iterator

        Iterator<E> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the items in this accumulator in proper sequence. Also this methods advances head of this accumulator.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<E extends Sequenced>
        Returns:
        an iterator over the items in this list accumulator in proper sequence.

      • getInfo

        AccumulatorInfo getInfo()
        Returns AccumulatorInfo of this accumulator.
        Returns:
        AccumulatorInfo of this accumulator.

      • setHead

        boolean setHead(long sequence)
        Tries to set head of this accumulator to the supplied sequence and returns true, if that sequence is still exist in this accumulator. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence number which will be the head of this accumulator.
        Returns:
        true if sequence is set, otherwise returns false

      • size

        int size()
        Current size of accumulator.
        Returns:
        returns current size of accumulator.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this accumulator contains no elements.
        Returns:
        true if this accumulator contains no elements

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets this accumulator. After return of this call, accumulator will be in its initial state.
